Reminder: Please join us at the Beachwood High School stadium tomorrow (Sunday, June 28th) from 2:00 - 3:00 pm to hear our students' voices at this Rally for Educational Equity. We will gather as a community to support our students' hopes and expectations for our school system. The rally is open to the public.

Out of caution and respect for the health of attendees and their loved ones, all participants will be required to wear a mask or other face covering the entire time. Physical distancing will be observed with households asked to stand together.

Beachwood City Schools has earned the State Board of Education's Momentum Award.

"Your 2019 Ohio School Report Card shows that your students made greater than expected progress in English language arts and mathematics. This makes the district part of a leading group of districts that are helping fulfill the vision stated in Each Child, Our Future, Ohio's strategic plan for education, that each child is challenged to discover and learn, prepared to pursue a fulfilling post-high school path and empowered to become a resilient, lifelong learner who contributes to society."

Congratulations to our Grades 4-8 students and their ELA and mathematics teachers -- these students' remarkable value-added measures earned this district award!

Thanks to all our community's parents and guardians as well as our entire district staff! Beachwood's successes are the product of our teamwork and values, as well as our support for each child AND one another. #GoBison
